comments.body: I don’t know how many times people have to be told this. The warden is not supposed to be attacked, or killed. It’s meant to be an obstacle. So this will not be added. Also it has a stupid recipe as who would wanna waste 3 scrap when a shield works just as well on a warden, and takes less damage.
Interesting.

That's a good idea. Or what if they added a block that is a bit harder to mine than stone, which generates more at deeper parts of the world. It would be a common block, but not a block that you don't want in almost any case like granite or diorite. It would probably be better if the world was deeper, but imo something like this would be cool as a mod or even a world type. If they add cubic chunks, (which I don't know if they could do), this would potentially make for a very different mining gameplay.
This is an interesting idea. I think I would want to see it tested out before deciding whether it should be added, because it could potentially change a lot of things about the game.
Maybe stone bricks are special because they are heavier then their normal brake speed.
there could be fallable blocks that have different falling speed based on its weight (heaviness/lightness).
Minecraft could have a big fort structure with big stone wall that can hold a village inside.
I love that idea, i wish i was in Mojang so I could add it!

a small, warden -like creature that puts out torches, rather than breaking them, and does not attack the player. It would also put out soul torches, Redstone torches, campfires, and actual fires, but won't approach lanterns, as they are too bright and sheltered behind glass.

It would be called the Cave Scuttler and spawn only in the deep dark. It would be uncommon, if not straight-up rare.
Great idea! It adds more challenge and a new type of mob, because we (maybe) never had a mob before that only comes out when the player is gone which is the opposite of most mobs in minecraft.

What if instead of griefing the torches when the player isn't there, the lurker could stop all torches being placed within a vicinity, the same amount of danger, but less griefing not caused by the player.

Citrine could also be made by heat treating amethyst in an oven. Maybe Citrine and quartz geodes could generate in the Nether. Or citrine geodes could generate deeper in the overworld than amethyst geodes.

Stalactites should create Stalagmites which would eventually connect and then get thicker, creating Dripstone Blocks. Eventually, Dripstone Caves would fill themselves in. This would be cool for making self healing containers/vaults, especially if their growth could be accelerated

I was just about to post almost the exact same post! One thing i'd add that this should be a really slow process. Not quite as slow as copper aging, but slower than the dripstones filling up cauldrons.
Definitely, I like to play bedrock on Split screen with my family, I never relized this would happen. I think it would be very weird having white fog :/
pretty
this needs to be implemented, the white fog ruins the immersion and is highly unrealistic.
not only in the deep ones, in all. Or if not, fix the bug of the 16 chunks in the servers so that I can maximize the distance xd

I had a simmilar idea, but the only difference from my idea was a Nether Fog for the deep dark, but would be completely pitch black, and would lower render distance. This could help make the Deep Dark less laggy as less chunks would be loaded in and the Warden would have better performance.
It is not possible to reproduce feedback with images anymore. Unless you copy an image under 2MB to the clipboard, then paste it.
if you collect it in a bucket, when you hold the magma bucket in your hand, it should give you the burning effect. It also should be able to become an infinite lava source, like water

There is ray tracing (RTX), which makes the lighting of minecraft one thousand times more realistic and appealing. I feel like this would be similar to that (maybe it could be called wave tracing or WTX), but it would be complicated and could cause lag on low ram computers. I do know there are a few things you can do on default that would be simple and cause no lag at all, such as increasing reverb on actions like falling four or more blocks, or mining stone.
At least in the deep dark.
I think that the grimstone its to much and the texture is the same of bedrock.
I feel like the Grimstone blocks should have its own cave biome. Idk, its weird seeing it all around us when exploring the caves.

I like it, but I think that there should be random places under 0 where there's spots of stone, too! It should be a slightly (very slightly) lighter texture as well to blend better. But I like how it kinda feels like youre mining into bedrock!
I kinda agree, I wish there were big veins of regular stone cutting through the Grimstone, and there should be some Tuff in there, too, that would really look fantastic.
I agree, it just makes the excitement of mining deeper gone because the overwhelming grimstone takes up HALF of it
I think it's just fine

Sorry but the texture for grimstone is really bad.

First thing, the ores are so easy to detect and they don't blend in at all which is not fun! We want it challenging to find.

That new grimstone is cool as an idea (hard rock, heavier to mine, darker places - darker stone) but the texture is bad. It looks like bricks and in general when you are looking at those caves it just doesn't feel natural...

Also other stone variants are not blending like andesite and so on.

When it comes to changing ores, if you are changing something change all of them to look and breathe similar. Diamond, lapis and few others just feels different now but not in a good way.

Grimstone's not a replacement for stone. it's just a denser version of it. Stone is only iconic because that's all we ever had to make stone tools and stone related recies until blackstone. There's still stone through all the layers of underground that we already had. I like the grimstone like it is because it goes really well with saying that you're in the new deep underground now, where things get more intense. We need more variation, just mostly stone isn't interesting. The only thing I'm worried about it is that if the big caves will look unnatural and weird if it's stone at the top and then suddenly turns to grimstone.
There's gonna be a crap ton more stone when they update the mountains. I think its perfect the way it is.
Yeah my post is alot the same, it's good to get the word out

But it isn’t a replacement. If you don’t like the grimstone just stay away from the new layers. It isn’t hard to avoid since the grimstone isn’t even replacing any stone, since it only generates at parts where pre-1.17 there wasn’t any stone. I like how it is now
I guess part of the problem, also is that you approach y=0 a whole lot quicker with some of these caves. it seems like quite a lot.
I do agree, but I think Grimstone aka Deepslate is a pressurized verison of stone, and it's similar to bedrock [the block] because of pressue {despite most blocks floating}.
Maybe you can feed them fish, and in exchange you can get a crystal from them that allows you to change the enchantment glow of your gear.
Not entirely sure about the crystal idea but I'm all in favor for more color in the sea.
The different colored glow squids could also drop colored ink sacs for more glowing blocks!
Kinda like the brown panda, but probably much less rare. Maybe a 10%-5% chance of being any ROY G BIV color. Dont think different colors should effect any kind of glowing drop tho
Colored ink sacks for dye and book writing in different colors
I think having a rare albino glow squid that gives off a special rainbow effect would be amazing.
like it! and very much likely to happen
Yea I like this idea! Maybe if instead of there being a void it’s the core biome?
Perhaps it could contain A new type of lava that slowly rises when it’s placed, kinda like that one level in donkey Kong country 2 lol idk. Someone elaborate to make this more interesting haha
Maybe ores could be more common here, giving the incentive to explore.

There should be a a
red (quartz) nether
Orange (iron)
Yellow (gold) nether+overworld
Green (emerald)
Indigo (obsidian normal/crying) all
Purple (steals enderpearls) just spawns in ender
how about we make it steal the thing it came from, and you have to give it a refined version of it's ore?

Actually, what about we change the behavior? And the look? I had an idea like this before. A little mob, lives in caves, elfish, like yours. A stone head, if you step on it, The mob will grow to player size and start attacking you. If not bothered, as little as a block.
It would probably be a bit complicated to make it steal a thing from your inventory, but I think it is a good idea.
Fake Minecraft
Really like the idea, very cool also they should be gray with a little bump on the back that would be the colour of the ore and they should drop 0-2 of the ore.
Good idea. It is a not aggressive or passive mob, we never had anything like it in Minecraft.
NONONONONONONONO
WE NEED MORE ACHEIVMENTS!
We could get a striped birthday hat as a reward to

I forgot to mention but all three of these new enchantments are exclusive to each other. 

For ex: I can not put True vision on a spyglass with sol sight.
I feel like sol sight is overpowered, and that the rest are too much like potions. But I do want enchantments on the telescope.

Here's one thought of mine:

Synchrony

Pairs the location that is being viewed with the sounds that can be heard there. This would be useful for detecting mobs without coming into close proximity of them. If there is a corner in a long cave, you wouldn't have to put yourself at risk of walking into a hoard of monsters to tell if they are there. However, the noises would be hard to distinguish from the bunch of mobs that are in the game, so listen carefully.

Tracing

Brightens, saturates, speeds up, increases the quantity and render distance of all particles. Here are a list of its benefits:

– status effects are made more distinguishable due to the increased saturation of the particles

– invisible entities are more conspicuous because their particles are more eye catching

This enchantment imbues the spyglass with a magic that focuses on particles. Negative effects of this on vision:

– Non-particles are rendered at 64 blocks, it increases the thinner the air is so this aspect makes the enchantment best above Y=256, but you will suffer from the thin atmosphere and cold

– Non-particles have very low saturation

– Non-particles are darker

This enchantment is better for filtering mobs or trying to better locate invisible entities.
Synchrony, tracing, clearsight and a way to magnify are all things I would love to see
Maybe sol sight should only work in clear weather during the day
I'd only want the first one. True vision would likely be java-exclusive as bedrock doesnt have glowing, and an enchantment that affects the durability of the item doesn't make sense.

@Issac Annear Your synchrony enchantment sounds cool, but I think that it shouldn't be a telescope enchantment, and instead a relic you can find in deep dark chests, becuase it is similar to the skulk sensor/warden's way of detecting vibrations.

398830310812

I see your point, but I still feel like it really fits as an enchantment. Lapis Lazuli is found underground, and there has been talk about the amethyst being a different type of enchantment power, so perhaps there could be something that grows in the deep dark that could also power the enchantment table for a different class of enchants. This would also balance out the renewability of enchantment power-items.

DarkstalkerMoon

I know bedrock does not have the glowing effect because it is the only version I play. I was implying that they would add the glowing effect to bedrock so that Clearsight can be on both versions.
Sol sight might be a good enchantment that you have a rare chance of finding in a woodlen mansion.

410378551692 I know that that was kind of implied, but knowing mojang, they will make the enchantment java-exclusive because it will be the easiest thing to do.

 

Also yes I got the clearsight reference.

The spyglass enhances one of three senses available to Minecraft so far. As such, enchantments that deal with the senses likely fit the theme of the spyglass the most. However, people have killed ants by focusing light on them, so weaponizing the spyglass isn't totally out of the question, as the spyglass works in a similar way to a laser cutter.
Fantastic ideas there will definitely make the spy glass much more useful!

It’s 2024 and I have a set of enchantments.

1. Night sight: like your clear vision but only works once the sun is down.
2. Through sight: makes the locations of placed torches visible through walls and floors, aiding navigation
3. Tography - allows the ability to take low res snapshot photos and creates a square placeable painting, but uses up durability of the spyglass. Would add a photography hobby dynamic to the game.
4. Alpha - sends dogs to area pointed at and sets them all to attack nearest enemy.

Currently, in Minecraft, you can't add Enchantments to a spyglass. If we could put Enchantments onto a spyglass, especially Unbreaking. If this gets approved by Mojang in their next update.

By,

TylerGaming1018
I don't like the idea of uranium because I'm pretty sure you can't just find uranium, otherwise life on Minecraft would not exist. Also, it is a little too futuristic for a medieval game.

What would these ores do? How could they improve the game? Adding ores for the sake of them being there is kinda pointless. No matter how cool they are, if they don't add anything meaningful to the game, then what's the point?

Addressing 399265256131's comment, Uranium is more common than Silver in real life, and it's not terribly radioactive. Uranium is super dense, and would make for, perhaps a high-knockback weapon. But I don't know how interested Mojang is in adding more weapons and armor right now.

Sapphire and Topaz don't seem particularly useful. Honestly, Amethyst, which has already been added, is pretty useless thus far (aside from making noise, telescopes, and special glass), perhaps we should be trying to figure out what to do with it before we think of adding more gems.

If we are to add more gems/crystals into the game then i would like them to have their uses similar to Amethyst in making more tools for caving, exploration, etc. The Ores in Minecraft are more for making armor and weapons and should have that unique difference between the crystals. If more crystals are gonna be added then i would like to see them being able to make utilities like a grappling hook or a climbing icepick for more transversal gameplay.

Í'd imagine Uranium Ore as to be used to craft a block to boost up brewing/smelting times of Brewing Stands/Furnaces/Blast Furnaces/Smokers. It is a directional block akin to a Hopper and you power it up with Uranium Core (the smelted Uranium Ore) and Water.
Stop with the random ore demands!!!! This is part of the reason why I was scared of a cave update!!!$

394741626112 I think Mojang did right by the cave update, only adding one ore and another crystal that can be achieved by other means besides mining. They are creative in a way not seen by most people on this site that just suggest junk items for no reason
No need for ores but they could be part of the archaeology. not uranium though it's a little too futuristic.
Cool idea! Just a side note though, the buckets should have different names, like Bucket of Cyan Axolotl or something like that
100% me and my friend were thinking about this the other day, it’d be really helpful and I feel a mainly simple fix

I it is just weird that there is pink axolotl in the bucket on the icon but really it could be a  blue, yellow, cyan, brown, or pink. It could really be any axolotl! Also if you play bedrock edition 1.20 trails and tales update use this commands to get a baby blue axolotl

/summon axolotl ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ minecraft:entity_born
Yeah, spore blossoms are kind of lackluster and disappointing, and take up too little space.
"Disappointing" is exactly the word I'm going to use when they come out with Lush caves feedback

No moss block, but moss carpet.

But maybe, only add new crafting, no delete old.
@MrD1085277 is right
Only add the new recipe don’t delete the old one we can have both recipes

Make it:

Block + carpet instead, I think making the whole block would require some checkerboard pattern that yields two.

But if with carpet, it'll be much simpler and cheaper to make.
8 cobble/stone brick + 1 moss block = 8 of that mossy variant
Or Maybe Both
I had this exact same idea, but if you craft the moss block with a stone type should you get two for the result?
How about you keep the old recipe, but if you add a moss carpet to stone, the new texture would look like a grass block, but with stone instead of dirt

I was gonna post this myself until I found out you posted this, good idea. I'm gonna go against the majority here and say removing the old recipe is actually a good idea. Most of the people here haven't even crafted mossy cobblestone before, they have no reason to complain about removing an old recipe when the item it crafts is most likely just as easy to obtain afterwards.
This would be a cool change as vines imo dont make sense
I like this idea a lot.
Interested in what this would look like. I think this would provide a whole new color pallete, which is always nice to have to switch things up.
Thanks
With Dripstone Bricks!
This is a great idea.
I love this idea!

I was thinking about a similar idea! Maybe some limitations to be considered: can only write on stone surfaces, maybe some limited text space or preset designs (stuff like arrows and pictographs)? Crafting chalk could maybe be done in furnaces. I would love something like this for making memos in caves and mines, since it can be so easy to get lost.
the only thing this would do is remove the use for signs.

Chalk feels like a good fit for minecraft. But I wouldn't want to write text: I would want to draw with it!

Chalk would work like a tool with durability. Clicking on a block would leave a colored pixel (maybe 4x4) depending on where the cursor is pointing on the block face. The chalk dust that you leave behind would be its own block like how Glow Lichen works in the new update, but you could fill it with up to 12 colored pixels. You can't draw on all blocks though - I'd make it depend on blast resistance so blocks like dirt or wool won't work. You would be able to dye the chalk from white just like how it works with wool, and it can wash off with water or break instantly with a brush. Probably make it from 3 calcite (and perhaps make calcite renewable by crafting 2 flint with 2 clay?)

Chalk that you can use to color things would open up a brand new avenue of creativity. You could draw blueprints, make pixel art, mark pathways in caves, or maybe even use it to make pseudo-wallpaper.
maybe we can use the chalk sticks as our advantage to get out of certain caves i just love this idea.
Maybe Azealia wood could have a very pale pink texture with a new bark texture on the outside to give some more building opportunities.
red wood! that's what it should look like?
This is the way.
I think you mojang should add the azalea wood I have an idea but I don't know how to share the photo
better add green wood to the azalea and if you can't then create some green bamboo planks
I agree!
Calcite is basically the diorite everyone wanted imo. Love the idea!

yes, we definetly need calcite bricks, pillars, chisled and even walls.. it is only actually white stone, closest is diorite in overworld but it isnt exactly most white and lacks brick variant, and endstone that is yellowish, making calcite still unique with color and texture for building use (still more unique than tuff bricks against stone bricks which is just slightly different shade of gray)
i agree, but it would have to be very rare
Or just maybe make it so it can spawn in any cave as a rare mob.
It should spawn really rare in cave entrances

some more creepy pasta alongside the warden

:D

I like the idea of environmental information identifying the killer bunny as being local, but I think this would be better implemented as a structural spawn like the witch hut. A couple near-surface small cave variants could spawn as structures in a biome-limited way. Not sure what structural aesthetic would fit best, perhaps bone stalactites or a small water source in the cave with a couple field blocks with carrots around it.
Maybe the killer bunny is more likely to spawn the more bunnies you've killed? It's like local difficulty but with bunnies.
